newsitem.title: USA: MSNBC in venture for German-language Internet news.
newsitem.headline: MSNBC in venture for German-language Internet news.

text.p: MSNBC, the joint venture between Microsoft Corp. and NBC, announced plans Wednesday to launch a German-language Internet news service in collaboration with Germany's ZDF public television network.

The ZDF-MSNBC service, expected to go live in August, will include original content developed by a staff of 20 dedicated journalists in Mainz, Germany, as well as news translated from MSNBC's Internet site, officials said.

Both ZDF and MSNBC will be making "a substantial investment" in the service, which will be supported exclusively by advertising, said Scott Moore, director of revenue and business development for MSNBC.
Moore said similar ventures ultimately might be arranged in other countries.

"I think over time you might see that happen," he said in an interview. "It depends on what kind of partners we can find in other places, and it depends how fast the market ramps up outside the United States."
Moore said use of the Internet in Europe is expected to grow rapidly with deregulation, which should lead to sharply lower telephone access charges.

ZDF will continue to provide content for a separate site on Microsoft's online Microsoft Network, Moore said. MSN has a similar arrangement with British news organizations, but Moore said the new German venture was on a larger scale.
NBC is a unit of General Electric Co.
